page.title: 08BURTON JOYCE-FARMING-CHANGES
page.content: Mrs.Kilborn told us how farming has changed since the war.Cows are now milked by machine,not hand and milk is loaded directly on to tankers;tractors are used instead of horses. Oats,barley and wheat were harvested by hand, stooked in the field and left to dry before threshing.Now a combine harvester is used.Hay was cut with a scythe by a row of men and turned by hand, now it is baled mechanically. Farms have become larger and are run as profit making concerns,not for mere subsistence.
